intro: Bulbostylis juncoides f. leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited bulbostylis, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance. This plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas. It has slender, erect stems with narrow, linear leaves, and its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, spike-like flowers. The distinguishing feature of this form is its white or pale-colored fruits, which set it apart from other forms of Bulbostylis. It plays a role in wetland ecosystems by contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
